qas.question: Why is Thurnigia's landscape shaped by human influence?

answers.text: Due to many centuries of intensive settlement

qas.question: What is the original natural vegetation of Thuringia?

answers.text: forest with beech as its predominant species

qas.question: What type of nature is common in the highlands of Thuringia?

answers.text: a mixture of beech and spruce

qas.question: What has been the aim for the Thuringian forests since 1990?
Where do most landscape problems come from?

answers.text: increasingly prolonged dry periods during the summer months

plausible_answers.text: Due to many centuries of intensive settlement

qas.question: Why is Thurnigia's landscape not shaped by human influence?

plausible_answers.text: forest with beech as its predominant species

qas.question: What is the original artificial vegetation of Thuringia?

plausible_answers.text: a mixture of beech and spruce

qas.question: What type of artificial product is common in the highlands of Thuringia?
What has been the aim for the Thuringian forests since 1970?

plausible_answers.text: increasingly prolonged dry periods during the summer months

qas.question: Where do most dreamscape problems come from?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Due to many centuries of intensive settlement<b5_0/><a0_0/>, most of the area is shaped by human influence. The original natural vegetation of Thuringia is <a1_0><b6_0>forest with beech as its predominant species<b6_0/><a1_0/>, as can still be found in the Hainich mountains today. In the uplands, <a2_0><b7_0>a mixture of beech and spruce<b7_0/><a2_0/> would be natural. However, most of the plains have been cleared and are in intensive agricultural use while most of the forests are planted with spruce and pine. Since 1990, Thuringia's forests have been managed aiming for a <a3_0><b8_0>more natural and tough vegetation<b8_0/><a3_0/> more resilient to climate change as well as diseases and vermin. In comparison to the forest, agriculture is still quite conventional and dominated by large structures and monocultures. Problems here are caused especially by <a4_0><b9_0>increasingly prolonged dry periods during the summer months<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
